chapter.title: Using the Testclient
chapter.section: What is the Testclient The Testclient is a GUI application which can communicate with OpenEngSB. This is done by sending messages into the bus and waiting for an answer. As soon as an answer is received it is displayed in a message box. You can choose the message, the recipient and the message type. The Testclient is a handy tool if you want to test OpenEngSB services or if you want to work with the Context directly.

section.title: Starting the Testclient
section.para:
To start the testclient execute the script testclient.sh in the scripts folder:
scripts/testclient.sh

section.title: The Message Tab
section.para:
There are five parameters of a message that can be set using the Testclient:
Context - The context id, which is used to distinguish between different project contexts Endpoint - The target endpoint of the message Operation - The operation field of the JBI message, which has to be set to "event" for event messages and to "methodcall" for service-calls MEP - The Message Exchange Pattern, that shall be used. Service-calls have to use in-out, whereas event messages have to use in-only or robust-in-only Payload - The textarea can be used to define the content of the message
Note: The load button can be used to load text from a file into the content textarea. The list of available endpoints is built from the list of consumers specified in the xbean.xml of the openengsb-test-jms-su project, which can be found in the directory >core/testclient/jms/service-unit/src/main/resources/.
To add additional endpoints add jms:consumer elements to core/testclient/jms/service-unit/src/main/resources/xbean.xml.

section.title: The Context Tab
section.para: The context tab will only work if the context service-unit is deployed. This is currently not the case if only the essential parts of the OpenEngSB are deployed.

On the left the tree structure of the context is shown. Clicking one of the nodes displays its key-value pairs in the table on the right side of the window. Changes can be made using the context menu or the buttons. If the value of an entry shall be changed just edit it directly in the table - it will be saved when the cell loses focus after editing. The "Refresh" button can be used to load changes that have been made concurrently by someone else.
